Got quite a few viruses from this, after installation, can't tell if they're from the skyrimlauncher for the patch, or not, but the patch's skyrim launcher seems to create a phoney "steam_api.dll missing" dialog and is 800KB vs the one provided by razor1911 which is over a MB. Use at your own risk. After playing check CTRL+ALT+DEL and see how many beautiful little viruses you now have. :
also no uninstall, so good luck getting rid of the game if you ever need to.
The update (at least) on this has a VIRUS.
So is this clean or does this have a virus? Can someone confirm, please?
I don't need the game or the update, BTW, just the mods. And is Mike's Mystic Mounts mod included?
@xhizors ever heard of "select folder" and then [shift]+[delete]? it is quite handy

tl;dr Yes, it's infected. No, I'm not the type of idiot who posts "VIRUS!" because an anti-malware program reports a cracked game file as infected.

Long: The updated SkyrimLauncher.exe file (about 800 kb) is a trojan that creates several faux-Microsoft folders in Users[name]AppDataRoaming. If ignored it eventually expands into Windows system directories and installs a rootkit. I stupidly and naively thought that the warnings were false-positives like most other cracks (this was before the other comments about infected files were posted), and eventually had to reformat everything. To be sure what was the cause of the problem, when run with the right precautions in place, it was definitely the cracked executable. The uploader commented in one of his other torrents that he checks everything with NOD32 and AVG first. He's either bad at doing that, or knowingly put up a trojan. It doesn't help that he never addressed the previous claims of a virus. If you're still seeding or leeching, you should stop and just look elsewhere.
